caption.p: Decoding using PMd and M1 separately, all trials

fn.p: Statistics for decoding choice from PMd and M1 data separately. Decoder performance refers to the fraction of trials for which the final decoded point agreed with the target that the animal reached to. This was assessed on forced-choice trials with delays of at least 300 ms, using leave-one-out cross-validation. Decoder agreement refers to the mean fraction of time points per trial for which the decoded choice was the same using the two datasets indicated. For this statistic, all successful trials with delay periods of at least 300 ms were included. ‘Combined’ refers to the decoder trained using both PMd and M1 data.
